abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is highly likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. These lessons were cited: 1) Building on prior
            sector work: The project clearly benefited from prior sector
            work on public sector management issues. Much of the project
            conditionality reflects the recommendations of these sector
            reports. 2) A pipeline of reforms: The project also
            benefited from the previous adjustment operation, the Public
            Sector Management Adjustment Credit Project PSMAC, which,
            among others, established the legislative framework for the
            civil service reforms supported by the project. By the same
            token, several of the first Public Sector Management
            Adjustment Loan PSMAL reforms will be followed-up under the
            new operations. 3) Limited number and specificity of
            conditions The relatively small number of conditions imposed
            under the PSMAL was a boon to implementation, as it
            permitted the Government to focus on a limited number of
            issues. The specificity of the reforms was also helpful, as
            it provided clear targets for reform efforts. 4) High level
            political support was critical to project success. Support
            from the Ministry of Finance was instrumental in offsetting
            internal and external opposition to reforms, particularly in
            pharmaceutical procurement.
